channel.title: Maths on Barnaby's Blog
channel.description: Recent content in Maths on Barnaby's Blog

item.title: Pragmatic Recurrence Relations: Why the Closed Form Won't Help You
item.author: bwreford.contact@gmail.com (Barnaby Wreford)
item.description: The Lesson # It’s easy to get hooked on the idea of performance and optimisation, but when it comes to recurrence relation problems in programming, it’s easy to fall into the trap of chasing the perfect solution.

item.title: Jane Street Puzzle: Beside The Point
item.author: bwreford.contact@gmail.com (Barnaby Wreford)
item.description: Problem Description # Two random points, one red and one blue, are chosen uniformly and independently from the interior of a square.
